div.div:
2012-06-05

img.title: IMAGE - Staying Alive: Could Thin-film Manufacturers Come Out Ahead in the PV Wars? Part 2

a.title: READ STORY - PV Industry Outsourcing is a Secret No More

h2.a: PV Industry Outsourcing is a Secret No More

div.div:
2012-06-06
| by
Paula Mints, Navigant Consulting

img.title: IMAGE - PV Industry Outsourcing is a Secret No More
img.alt: IMAGE - PV Industry Outsourcing is a Secret No More

div.div:
Shocking though it may be, outsourcing is commonplace in the PV industry. Basically, with outsourcing Manufacturer A buys cells or modules from Manufacturer B and both report the outsourced product as in-house production. Outsourcing, which, pardon the cliché, is as old as the hills, has led to a systematic oversizing of the photovoltaic industry. The practice of oversizing also includes module assembler production – referring to module assemblers who do not develop or manufacturer photovoltaic technology in-house. Again, outsourcing is common to all industries that manufacture widgets of any type, and has been practiced by the photovoltaic industry for its entire kilowatt-to-gigawatt size history.
Full Story »

The practice of oversizing also includes module assembler production \u2013 referring to module assembler...');ua.addMediaItem({ type: 'image',src: 'http://www.renewableenergyworld.com/assets/images/story/2012/6/6/1332-pv-industry-outsourcing-is-a-secret-no-more.jpg',href: 'http://www.renewableenergyworld.com/rea/news/article/2012/06/pv-industry-outsourcing-is-a-secret-no-more'});var shareParams = {userAction: ua,shareButtons: [{provider: 'share'}],containerID: 'sbf276250'};gigya.socialize.showShareBarUI(shareParams);

img.alt: IMAGE - Military Biofuels Ban Moves Forward, Ignites Criticism, Backlash

a.title: READ ARTICLE - Military Biofuels Ban Moves Forward, Ignites Criticism, Backlash

h2.a: Military Biofuels Ban Moves Forward, Ignites Criticism, Backlash

td.div:
By
Meg Cichon, Associate Editor, RenewableEnergyWorld.com
2012-06-06
| Post Your Comment
